question: 時候
sourceMnemonic:
The <kanji>time</kanji>'s <kanji>climate</kanji> is the current <vocabulary>season</vocabulary>. Each season has different <vocabulary>weather</vocabulary> and exists in a different <vocabulary>time of year</vocabulary>.

Note that this word has an old-fashioned feel to it, and isn't common in modern Japanese.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
